physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At initial presentation at 4 months of age, laboratory analyses revealed elevated levels of inflammation markers (C-reactive protein), erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and markedly elevated total serum alkaline phosphatase (TSAP) levels (1248 U/L; upper norm, 341 U/L).

Developed severe coxa vara with Shepherd’s crook deformity bilaterally, bowing deformities, and a pathological fracture of the left tibia during treatment. Suffered from frequent bone pain and sensorineural hearing loss.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Despite reduction in TSAP levels with bisphosphonate treatment, bone deformities were progressive, and pain returned after initial relief following treatment.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Serum calcium: 2.08 mmol/L (normal, 2.15–2.45); ionized calcium: 0.87 mmol/L (lower norm, 1.1)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Severe hypocalcemia developed 5 hours after the first denosumab injection, requiring hospitalization and IV calcium supplementation for 3 days.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Post-denosumab, calcium requirements were elevated initially but decreased 17 days later as stabilization occurred.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Marked hypercalcemia observed 7 weeks after second dose of denosumab, with symptoms of polyuria, nausea, and constipation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Hypercalcemia developed rapidly only 4 days after a normal calcium reading, indicating a severe fluctuation.
